remarks: Lemma for ~ dia2dim .  Convert ordering hypothesis on ` R `` F ` to subspace membership ` F e. ( I `` ( U .\/ V ) ) ` .  (Contributed by NM, 8-Sep-2014.)
statement:
dia2dimlem11.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
dia2dimlem11.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
dia2dimlem11.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
dia2dimlem11.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
dia2dimlem11.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dia2dimlem11.t $e |- T = ( ( LTrn ` K ) ` W ) $.
dia2dimlem11.r $e |- R = ( ( trL ` K ) ` W ) $.
dia2dimlem11.y $e |- Y = ( ( DVecA ` K ) ` W ) $.
dia2dimlem11.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` Y ) $.
dia2dimlem11.pl $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` Y ) $.
dia2dimlem11.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` Y ) $.
dia2dimlem11.i $e |- I = ( ( DIsoA ` K ) ` W ) $.
dia2dimlem11.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dia2dimlem11.u $e |- ( ph -> ( U e. A /\ U .<_ W ) ) $.
dia2dimlem11.v $e |- ( ph -> ( V e. A /\ V .<_ W ) ) $.
dia2dimlem11.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. T ) $.
dia2dimlem11.uv $e |- ( ph -> U =/= V ) $.
dia2dimlem11.fe $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( I ` ( U .\/ V ) ) ) $.
dia2dimlem11 $p |- ( ph -> F e. ( ( I ` U ) .(+) ( I ` V ) ) ) $.
